intro: Pouzolzia piscicelliana, commonly known as the water pouzolzia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces tiny, greenish flowers that are often overlooked due to their size. Pouzolzia piscicelliana is typically found in moist environments such as wetlands and along stream banks.
